page.title: 01THE HOLIDAY RESORT OF RHYL
page.content: Rhyl is a seaside resort on the North Wales coast easily reached by holidaymakers. It is about 30 miles from the nearest motorway and it has a main line railway station. Its sandy beach is 2 miles long and the promenade and streets are flat so it is a good place for disabled and retired people. It enjoys better weather than most parts of North Wales so the "WELCOME TO SUNNY RHYL" sign, seen as you enter the town, is often proved to be true. There are many self-catering holiday flatlets and today these are more popular than the boarding houses. Recently a new Sun Centre and Shopping Precinct have been built. It is a good starting place for tours into the pretty countryside of the Vale of Clwyd and Snowdonia.
